Package bacnet.datamodel.dataset

Class ExpressionMatrix

  • java.lang.Object
    • bacnet.datamodel.dataset.OmicsData
      • bacnet.datamodel.dataset.ExpressionMatrix
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ProteomicsData
    public class ExpressionMatrix
extends OmicsData
implements java.lang.Cloneable, java.io.Serializable
    This is the principal data model used in the software for managing big table of expression
    Author:
    christophebecavin
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      (package private) class  ExpressionMatrix.ExpressionMatrixCompare
      I create this comparator in the case where the key are Integer, we use then the Integer comparator instead of String --- Because with String normal comparator 1,2,3,10,12 will be classified as 1,10,12,2,3 ---

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class bacnet.datamodel.dataset.OmicsData

        OmicsData.ColNames, OmicsData.TypeData

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private java.lang.String[][] annotations
      String[][] for all annotation information
      private java.lang.String firstRowName
      The name of first row used when converted to an array
      private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> headerAnnotation
      we put all important informations in a table (which should be of the size of "values")
      private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> headers
      Column names are in an ArrayList so we can navigate easily, and have access to the index of the column just by giving an header
      private boolean loaded
      Indicates if an ExpressionMatrix has been loaded or not
      private boolean ordered
      Indicates wether or not rows need to be ordered thanks to ArrayList orderedRowNames
      private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> orderedRowNames
      In some cases (clustering for example) we need the row to be specifically organized We use a List to force the organization of the row A boolean indicate if this matrix as to be used.
      private java.util.TreeMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Integer> rowNames
      the rowNames are in a TreeMap to have a matching between names and index in values array, we navigate easily in the TreeMap which is sorted (using a modifyed Comparator)
      private java.lang.String secondRowName
      The name of second row used when converted to an array
      private static long serialVersionUID  
      private double[][] values
      I use an array of double to gain memory and increase access time

      Export in an array a List of ExpressionMatrix All ExpressionMatrix from the list are supposed to have the same headers, and thus the same number of column The first column = the annotation of each ExpressionMatrix The second column = the RowNames of each ExpressionMatrix

    • Field Detail

      • serialVersionUID

        private static final long serialVersionUID
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • rowNames

        private java.util.TreeMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Integer> rowNames
        the rowNames are in a TreeMap to have a matching between names and index in values array, we navigate easily in the TreeMap which is sorted (using a modifyed Comparator)

      • orderedRowNames

        private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> orderedRowNames
        In some cases (clustering for example) we need the row to be specifically organized We use a List to force the organization of the row A boolean indicate if this matrix as to be used.

      • ordered

        private boolean ordered
        Indicates wether or not rows need to be ordered thanks to ArrayList orderedRowNames

      • headers

        private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> headers
        Column names are in an ArrayList so we can navigate easily, and have access to the index of the column just by giving an header

      • values

        private double[][] values
        I use an array of double to gain memory and increase access time

      • headerAnnotation

        private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> headerAnnotation
        we put all important informations in a table (which should be of the size of "values")

      • annotations

        private java.lang.String[][] annotations
        String[][] for all annotation information

      • firstRowName

        private java.lang.String firstRowName
        The name of first row used when converted to an array

      • secondRowName

        private java.lang.String secondRowName
        The name of second row used when converted to an array

      • loaded

        private transient boolean loaded
        Indicates if an ExpressionMatrix has been loaded or not

      • getGenomeViewerColumnIndex

        public int getGenomeViewerColumnIndex()
        Return the appropriate column index for displaying in the Genome viewer
        By order of priority:
      • LOGFC containing column
      • FC containing column
      • p-value containing column
      • VALUE
      • first column
Returns:

  • load

    public static ExpressionMatrix load​(java.lang.String fileName)
    Read compressed, serialized data with a FileInputStream. Uncompress that data with a GZIPInputStream. Deserialize the vector of lines with a ObjectInputStream. Replace current data with new data, and redraw everything.

  • load

    public void load()
    Read compressed, serialized data with a FileInputStream. Uncompress that data with a GZIPInputStream. Deserialize the vector of lines with a ObjectInputStream. Replace current data with new data, and redraw everything.

  • save

    public void save​(java.lang.String fileName)
    Serialize the vector of lines with an ObjectOutputStream. Compress the serialized objects with a GZIPOutputStream. Write the compressed, serialized data to a file with a FileOutputStream. Don't forget to flush and close the stream.

  • save

    public void save()
    Serialize the vector of lines with an ObjectOutputStream. Compress the serialized objects with a GZIPOutputStream. Write the compressed, serialized data to a file with a FileOutputStream. Don't forget to flush and close the stream.

                                               java.lang.String secondRowName,

    Export in an array a List of ExpressionMatrix All ExpressionMatrix from the list are supposed to have the same headers, and thus the same number of column The first column = the annotation of each ExpressionMatrix The second column = the RowNames of each ExpressionMatrix
